Events that occurred on 8 July.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1915 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes the poem The Shores of Elfland.
1953 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 137e.
1963 - J.R.R. Tolkien's paper "English and Welsh" is published in Angles and Britons: O'Donnell Lectures.
1969 â€“ J.R.R. Tolkien is diagnosed with an inflamed or diseased gall-bladder. Dr. Denis Tolhurst forbids him the consummation of fats (notably butter) and, even worse, alcohol.
1973 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Norman Power.
1999 - The first Tolkien Thing is held in Cologne.
2010 - Tolkien Calendar 2011 is published.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
